alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 02 at 10:06AM CST until January 08 at 8:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Rock Island, Henry IL and Whiteside Counties. .Forecast moderate to locally heavy rainfall tonight into Tuesday morning, combined with ice action may produce flooding on the Rock River near Joslin by mid week. At this time there is limited confidence associated with rainfall amounts, extent of run-off, and location of predicted rainfall. Ice action may also be a factor in alternating river levels. As the forecast becomes more certain, this watch will either be upgraded to a warning or cancelled. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding of unprotected agricultural land occurs. Water also affects Lundeens Landing Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Monday the stage was 11.6 feet and steady. - Ice action may produce fluctuations of a foot or more from the expected river rise and crest levels. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
